item.title: Comment on How we should update our views on immigration by sonofid
item.description:
This is a strange selection of countries to discuss. The US is unique in having the pick of the world’s most ambitious and qualified people. Israel and Taiwan are geopolitically unique. Normally the cultural issue with immigration is not some hostile power trying to undermine you.

From a European perspective it seems odd not to confront the mix of indigenous demographic collapse and massively increased mobility from highly populous Middle Eastern and North African countries. The French elections strongly imply an enormous political backlash. Muslims are also organising as a political bloc in the UK General Election. Whatever the economic benefits of individual migrant groups the high levels of social and political conflict must impose some costs and be worth some comment? The combination of extensive welfare states, restricted housing with large-scale immigration is polically explosive
